learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate fluency in and command of a set repertoire for this course
Analyse and communicate pitch and rhythmic structures of selected repertoire
Sing and notate familiar and unfamiliar musical material
Demonstrate accuracy, confidence, fluency and the ability to work creatively in musical tasks
Engage critically and reflectively with methodologies of aural musicianship
Place the skills of knowledge acquired in a wider critical framework

assessments.task_description:
Students submit practical work for assessment in two parts (each worth 20%) comprising:


Part 1 (due week 6)

1—Individual Technical Work:

  • Sung performance of scales in context with individual partwork component
  • Performance of set rhythmic reading task 

2—Individual Part Work:

  • Individual partwork performance of canon (one part sung, other parts played)

3—Keyboard Accompaniment: 

  • Sung performance of course repertoire with keyboard accompaniment

4—Ensemble Work:

  • Small ensemble performance of course repertoire with one voice per part.


Part 2 (due week 12)

1—Individual Technical Work:

  • Sung performance of scales in abstract with individual partwork component
  • Performance of set rhythmic reading task 

2—Individual Part Work:

  • Individual partwork performance of canon (one part sung, other parts played)

3—Keyboard Accompaniment: 

  • Sung performance of course repertoire with keyboard accompaniment

4—Ensemble Work:

  • Small ensemble performance of course repertoire with one voice per part.


All required assessment tasks will be modelled clearly during the practical musicianship classes.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Both parts of Practical Musicianship assessment will be submitted in the form of a video recording in which students are clearly identified to the assessor. Work submitted that does not provide sufficiently clear identification of the student will not be accepted. Technical standard of the recording process does not need to be professional, but must audibly clear (no distortion) and adequately framed and lit. Detailed instructions for submission of material will be provided via the course blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
24/10/2024

The Aural Perception Exam will be held during the aural musicianship class times in week 13. Students attend at the class time to which they have been allocated during the semester.
assessments.task_description:
In-class test held in week 13 during class, which will test the following skills:

1—Rhythmic dictation

2—Intervallic dictation

3—Scale recognition

4—Melodic dictation

  • One-part
  • Two-part

5—Harmonic dictation


A practice test will be run in week 12 during class.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students will be provided with an exam paper on which to enter answers. The papers will be collected by staff at the end of the examination.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.due_date:
22/07/2024 - 11/10/2024

Internal due dates for individual tasks for the journal will be advised through Blackboard and in class.
assessments.task_description: Students will use an electronic journal in Blackboard to document a range of small formative learning activities related to research techniques and critical thinking and reflection as preparation for the literature review.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission will be through regular journal entries
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description: Students will complete a literature review of a selection of material focussed on aural musicianship. The literature review allows students to demonstrate their ability to place the activities and skills of the aural musicianship class into a wider critical and pedagogical framework informed by relevant literature.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Literature review are submitted via a Turnitin link provided in the MUSC7060 Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(22 Jul - 27 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Seminar

Weekly one-hour seminar in which students work on a range of tasks which develop critical and research specific skills in relation to the practical work. Work includes research techniques, information retrieval, critical reflection on readings, class discussion, short writing tasks.


Learning outcomes: L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Seminar Weekly one-hour seminar in which students work on a range of tasks which develop critical and research specific skills in relation to the practical work. Work includes research techniques, information retrieval, critical reflection on readings, class discussion, short writing tasks.

learning_activities.topic:
Aural Musicianship Class

Two-hour weekly class in which students engage in active learning through a range of aural musicianship skills.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
